page.title: 16THE SCOUT CAMP NEAR BRAMHOPE
page.content: The camp which covers 15 acres,some of it wooded,was given to the{Scout {Trust Association}by Major Bullock in 1933.It has been used since by Venture Scouts,Cubs,Guides,Brownies,St.John's Ambulance Brigade and School Parties. On the site there are some permanent buildings.These include the Warden's bungalow,a storm hut and toilet block, with hot and cold water.A new activities centre is being built and within it are five eight - bunk dorms, a dining room and a kitchen.The site also houses the{John Briggs Training {Centre}where Scouters,Guiders and Youth Leaders receive training.In 1981 the federated scouts of the world held their first ever{Jamboree}here.Boys and girls travelled from many European cities,from the U.S.A.and other continents. By CHERYL GIBSON.
